**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:

> Uncomment only one, leave it on its own line: 
>
/kind bug
> /kind feature


**What happened**:
When creating a RBD StorageClass without explicitly setting the `adminId` parameter and later removing a PVC, the corresponding PV goes into failed state.
Relevant logs are:
```
{"log":"E0715 08:16:20.765812       1 rbd_util.go:402] failed to delete rbd image: exit status 1, command output: 2017-07-15 08:16:20.660590 7f77606bc780 -1 did not load config file, using default settings.\n","stream":"stderr","time":"2017-07-15T08:16:20.766155923Z"}
{"log":"2017-07-15 08:16:20.669339 7f77606bc780  0 librados: client. authentication error (1) Operation not permitted\n","stream":"stderr","time":"2017-07-15T08:16:20.766175648Z"}
{"log":"rbd: couldn't connect to the cluster!\n","stream":"stderr","time":"2017-07-15T08:16:20.766182457Z"}
```

After looking at the code, I see that default value for `adminId` (which is "admin" as is stated in the [documentation](https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes/#ceph-rbd)) is only [checked when provisioning a volume](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/release-1.7/pkg/volume/rbd/rbd.go#L308). However when deleting a volume, [there is no check](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/release-1.7/pkg/volume/rbd/rbd.go#L202). The value is empty, that explains the `client.` part of the log, usually this is `client.admin`

**What you expected to happen**:
The volume to get released and deleted.
